What Would Life Be Without Dreams

Content

Frankfurt Airport – Gateway to the World. Thousands of travelers pass through every day, but only a few remain: the inhabitants of the transit zone, people without papers, refugees waiting for their destiny.

Among them is Nisha (Masumi Makhija), a young Indian woman who has been stranded at the airport for months. She lives in a hidden world beneath the terminals, where an unusual community has formed – people from all corners of the world united by their stateless existence.

When Russian pilot Alexej (Valera Nikolaev) discovers the underground world, he falls in love with Nisha. But their love seems impossible – he belongs to the world outside, she is trapped in the airport's purgatory.

"Gate to Heaven" is a poetic fairy tale about love, freedom, and the longing for home – told without words, in Veit Helmer's signature visual style.
